what: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
title: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
text: Warning package active development. API may change. multi (Morphometric UtiLiTIes) provides utility functions make basic steps — cleaning street networks, creating spatial units, etc. — urban morphometric analyses easier.

title: Utility Functions For Urban Morphometric Analyses
text: can install development version multi GitHub :

title: Bangalore Highways — bangalore_highways
text: one three datasets example morpometric data obtained OpenStreetMap using osmdata package. Data (c) OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright dataset contains geometry defines streets study area Bangalore.

title: Bangalore Highways — bangalore_highways
Bangalore Highways — bangalore_highways
text: sf LINESTRING geometries streets study area.

what: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: Create street block spatial units.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
code: st_create_streetblocks(   x,   boundary,   merge_threshold = 4050,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   verbose = T )

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: x sf object LINESTRING geometries representing street network. boundary sf object POLYGON geometries representing extents study area. merge_threshold numeric; value represents smallest acceptable size spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. merge_type string; Passed st_merge_spatialunits. Criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing street block spatial units.

title: Create street block spatial units. — st_create_streetblocks
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = 1, verbose = FALSE) #> Spherical geometry (s2) switched off #> Warning: The `sf` geometry column was renamed before merging. #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is FALSE plot(street_blocks)

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: Create tessellated spatial units.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
code: st_create_tessellations(   x,   boundary,   segment_length = 0.5,   shrink_extent = 0.4,   merge_threshold = NULL,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   type = c("morphological"),   verbose = T )

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing buildings. boundary sf object POLYGON geometries representing extents study area. segment_length numeric; Length segments building polygons subdivided . Default = 0.5. See Fleischmann et al., 2020 details. shrink_extent numeric; Extent inward buffer building polygons. Default = 0.4. See Fleischmann et al., 2020 details. merge_threshold numeric; value represents smallest acceptable size spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. merge_type string; Passed st_merge_spatialunits. Criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". type string; Type tessellated spatial unit create. Default = "morphological". Note: Currently, "morphological" tessellation implemented. verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing tessellated spatial units.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
text: Fleischmann, M., Feliciotti, ., Romice, O., & Porta, S. (2020). Morphological tessellation way partitioning space: Improving consistency urban morphology plot scale. Computers, Environment Urban Systems, 80, 101441.

title: Create tessellated spatial units. — st_create_tessellations
code: tessellations <- st_create_tessellations(x = bangalore_buildings, boundary = bangalore_boundary, segment_length = 0.5, shrink_extent = 0.4, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: Small geometries (< 1 m^2) may be present. Use st_merge_spatialunits() to aggregate them. plot(tessellations)

title: Extract connected streets from a data frame containing linestrings representing street networks. — st_extract_connected
code: connected_streets <- st_extract_connected(bangalore_highways) #> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_intersects assumes that they #> are planar connected_streets #> Simple feature collection with 417 features and 2 fields #> Geometry type: LINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 77.5771 ymin: 12.95439 xmax: 77.59503 ymax: 12.97567 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> First 10 features: #>            osm_id     highway                       geometry #> 8687347   8687347 residential LINESTRING (77.58983 12.960... #> 22893740 22893740     primary LINESTRING (77.58761 12.967... #> 23076921 23076921   secondary LINESTRING (77.58399 12.963... #> 23076927 23076927     primary LINESTRING (77.58735 12.967... #> 23076955 23076955    tertiary LINESTRING (77.58846 12.967... #> 23081473 23081473 residential LINESTRING (77.58395 12.963... #> 23081479 23081479 residential LINESTRING (77.58751 12.960... #> 23081496 23081496 residential LINESTRING (77.58227 12.961... #> 23081501 23081501 residential LINESTRING (77.58127 12.961... #> 23081545 23081545 residential LINESTRING (77.57966 12.961...

text: x sf object LINESTRING geometries representing street networks. threshold integer; minimum number intersecting roads needed count intersection. Default = 2.

title: Extract street intersections. — st_extract_intersections
text: sf object POINT geometries representing street intersections.

what: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: Iteratively merge spatial units ensure meet minimum area threshold.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
code: st_merge_spatialunits(   x,   merge_threshold,   merge_type = "min_centroid_distance",   verbose = T )

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing spatial units merged. merge_threshold numeric; value square meters represents smallest acceptable area spatial unit. Contiguous units iteratively merged value reached. skip process, set merge_threshold = NULL. merge_type string; criteria polygons merged. Must one "min_centroid_distance", "min_shared_boundary", "max_shared_boundary". Default = "min_centroid_distance". verbose logical; FALSE status messages output.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
text: sf object POLYGON geometries representing street block spatial units.

title: Iteratively merge spatial units to ensure all of them meet a minimum area threshold. — st_merge_spatialunits
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: Small geometries (< 1 m^2) may be present. Use st_merge_spatialunits() to aggregate them. street_blocks_merged <- st_merge_spatialunits(x = street_blocks, merge_threshold = 4050, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: The `sf` geometry column was renamed before merging. plot(street_blocks_merged)

what: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
text: Survey set spatial units get summary statistics.

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
text: x sf object POLYGON geometries representing spatial units surveyed. trim numeric; fraction (0 0.5) values trimmed end compute trimmed mean

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
text: data.frame object numeric values min, max, mean, median.

title: Survey a set of spatial units to get summary statistics. — st_survey_spatialunits
code: street_blocks <- st_create_streetblocks(x = bangalore_highways, boundary = bangalore_boundary, merge_threshold = NULL, verbose = FALSE) #> Warning: Small geometries (< 1 m^2) may be present. Use st_merge_spatialunits() to aggregate them. survey_report <- st_survey_spatialunits(x = street_blocks) #>   category description value              #> 1 Area     Min         8.259066e-01 [m^2] #> 2 Area     Max         8.031008e+04 [m^2] #> 3 Area     Mean        3.006233e+03 [m^2] #> 4 Area     Median      3.006233e+03 [m^2] survey_report #>   category description              value #> 1     Area         Min 8.259066e-01 [m^2] #> 2     Area         Max 8.031008e+04 [m^2] #> 3     Area        Mean 3.006233e+03 [m^2] #> 4     Area      Median 3.006233e+03 [m^2]
